Edit metadata templates

Source: vignettes/edit_metadata_templates.Rmd
edit_metadata_templates.Rmd

Editing

While a substantial portion of metadata is automatically extracted by the templating functions, most templates require some user input. Templates can be edited in simple text and spreadsheet editors. Specific editing instructions are below.

NOTE:

  • Some content in tabular templates is optional. Leave these spaces blank (no need to add NAs).
  • Only UTF-8 encoded characters are supported by EML.
  • Keep template content simple. Complex formatting can lead to errors.

abstract.txt

Like a journal article, the abstract provides a concise summary of the data package. It should cover what, why, when, where, and how.

Example:

abstract.txt
Development of the oil sands has led to increasing atmospheric N deposition, with values as high as 17 kg N ha^-1 yr^-1; regional background levels <2 kg N ha^-1 yr^-1. Bogs, being ombrotrophic, may be especially susceptible to increasing N deposition. To examine responses to N deposition, over five years, we experimentally applied N (as NH4NO3) to a bog near Mariana Lakes, Alberta, at rates of 0, 5, 10, 15, 20, and 25 kg N ha^-1 yr^-1, plus controls (no water or N addition). In May of each year, we collected mixed vascular plant tissue and Sphagnum fuscum peat and placed homogenized mixtures in nylon bags and placed them approximately 10 cm below the peat surface in early June. Bags were collected again in October of each year, cleaned, dried, and weighed. Decomposition of Sphagnum moss and mixed vascular plant litter was affected by N inputs, on average losing 8 and 38 % of initial mass, respectively, over 5 months of decomposition. Water addition alone had no significant effect on decomposition of cellulose, Sphagnum, or vascular plant litter (p > 0.15).

methods.txt

Describe the specific methods used to create the data. Include as much detail as necessary to allow a future scientist to assess fitness for use. Add instrument descriptions, protocols, etc.

Example:

methods.txt
In 2014 and 2015, we quantified decomposition of plant litter material collected from each plot. In late May, we collected vascular plant litter from the surface of each plot, along with Sphagnum peat (S. fuscum-derived), from roughly 5-15 cm below the capitula. We placed nylon mesh litter bags with mixed vascular plant litter (approx. 1.7 g dry mass; roughly equal masses of Rhododendron groenlandicum, Andromeda polifolia, Chamaedaphne calyculata, Smilacina trifolia, and Rubus chamaemorus) or peat approximately 10 cm below the peat surface in early June (in 2014, 3 bags per plot of vascular litter and 3 bags of Sphagnum peat; in 2015, 4 bags of each material). Upon retrieval in October of each year, we manually removed debris from each retrieved bag before drying at 55 C for a minimum of 5 days, and weighing.

keywords.txt

Keywords facilitate search and discovery on scientific terms, as well as names of research groups, field stations, and other organizations. Using a controlled vocabulary or thesaurus vastly improves discovery (e.g.Â LTER.

keywords.txt is a tab delimited table with columns:

  • keyword One keyword per row.
  • keywordThesaurus (optional) URI of controlled vocabulary from which the keyword was found.

Example:

keywords.txt
keyword keywordThesaurus
Villanova Peatland Biogeochemistry Group
bog https://vocab.lternet.edu/vocab/vocab/index.php
peat https://vocab.lternet.edu/vocab/vocab/index.php
vascular
moss https://vocab.lternet.edu/vocab/vocab/index.php
decomposition

personnel.txt

Personnel and funding information facilitates attribution and credit for the data package.

personnel.txt is a tab delimited table with columns:

  • givenName First name
  • middleInitial (optional) Middle initial
  • surName Last name
  • organizationName Organization the person is associated with
  • electronicMailAddress Email address
  • userId (optional) Personâ€™s unique identifier (e.g.Â ORCID).
  • role Personâ€™s role with respect to the data package. Persons serving more than one role, or roles shared among more than one person, should be added as separate lines. Valid roles are:
    • creator Data package author
    • PI (optional) Principal investigator associated with the data package.
    • contact Data package contact. Can be an organization or position (e.g.Â data manager). To do this, enter the organization or position name under givenName and leave middleInitial and surName empty.
    • publisher Data package publisher. Can be a person, organization, or position (e.g.Â data manager). Note: Data repositories are publishers and may replace the contents you supply with their own.
    • Any other roles are acceptable and will be listed under associated party (e.g.Â Field Technician).
  • projectTitle (optional) Project title the data package was created under. Only list project titles on lines where the personnel role is PI. If an ancillary project was involved, then add a new row below the primary project with the ancillary project title and associated PI. Repeat for additional ancillary projects.
  • fundingAgency (optional) Agency the project was funded by. Only list on lines where the role is PI.
  • fundingNumber (optional) Grant or award number funding the project. Only list on lines where the role is PI.

Example:

personnel.txt
givenName middleInitial surName organizationName electronicMailAddress userId role projectTitle fundingAgency fundingNumber
Kelman R Wieder Villanova University kelman.wieder@villanova.edu 0000-0001-5856-8473 PI Nitrogen Addition Experiments in Boreal Ecosystems: Understanding the Fate of Atmospherically Deposited Nitrogen in order to Determine Nitrogen Critical Loads Cumulative Environmental Management Association (CEMA) 2011-0003
Melanie A Vile Villanova University mvile@villanova.edu PI Decomposition in the real world NSF 111001
Kelman R Wieder Villanova University kelman.wieder@villanova.edu 0000-0001-5856-8473 contact
Information manager Villanova University info@villanova.edu 0000-0001-5856-8473 contact
Kelman R Wieder Villanova University kelman.wieder@villanova.edu 0000-0001-5856-8473 creator
Dale H Vitt Southern Illinois University creator
Melanie A Vile Villanova University mvile@villanova.edu creator
Jeremy A Graham Southern Illinois University jeremyg@mtu.edu creator
Jeremy A Hartsock Southern Illinois University hartsock@siu.edu creator
Hope Fillingim Villanova University fillingimhope@gmail.com creator
Melissa House Southern Illinois University mhouse@siu.edu creator
James C Quinn Villanova University jcqui03@gmail.com creator
Kimberli D Scott Villanova University kscott@villanova.edu creator
Meaghan Petix Southern Illinois University meaghan.petix@wsu.edu creator
Kelly J McMillen Villanova University Kelly.Mcmillen@ttu.edu creator
James C Quinn Villanova University jcqui03@gmail.com instrument technician

intellectual_rights.txt

The intellectual rights license describes how the data package may be used in the future. We strongly recommend releasing without restriction (CC0) or with minimal attribution (CC BY).

Example:

intellectual_rights.txt
This data package is released to the "public domain" under Creative Commons CC0 1.0 "No Rights Reserved" (see: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/). It is considered professional etiquette to provide attribution of the original work if this data package is shared in whole or by individual components. A generic citation is provided for this data package on the website https://portal.edirepository.org (herein "website") in the summary metadata page. Communication (and collaboration) with the creators of this data package is recommended to prevent duplicate research or publication. This data package (and its components) is made available "as is" and with no warranty of accuracy or fitness for use. The creators of this data package and the website shall not be liable for any damages resulting from misinterpretation or misuse of the data package or its components. Periodic updates of this data package may be available from the website. Thank you.

additional_info.txt

(Optional) Ancillary information about a data package not within the scope of abstract or methods (e.g.Â list of research articles created from this dataset).

Example:

additional_info.txt
Articles derived from this dataset: Article 1, Article 2, Article 3

attributes_*.txt

(Required if data package contains data tables) Well documented data table attributes facilitate human and machine understanding.

attributes.txt is a tab delimited table with columns:

  • attributeName Column name
  • attributeDefinition Column definition
  • class Column class. Valid options are:
    • numeric Numeric variable
    • categorical Categorical variable (i.e.Â nominal)
    • character Free text character variable (e.g.Â notes)
    • Date Date and time variable
  • unit Column unit. Required for numeric classes. Select from the standard unit dictionary, accessible via the R console command view_unit_dictionary(). If not found, then define as a custom unit (see custom_units.txt).
  • dateTimeFormatString Format string. Required for Date classes. Valid format string components are:
    • Y Year
    • M Month
    • D Day
    • h Hour
    • m Minute
    • s Second All separators of format string components (e.g.Â - / Â :) are supported.
  • missingValueCode Missing value code. Required for columns containing a missing value code).
  • missingValueCodeExplanation Definition of missing value code.

Example:

attributes_decomp.txt
attributeName attributeDefinition class unit dateTimeFormatString missingValueCode missingValueCodeExplanation
type Vegetation type: Sphagnum fuscum or vascular plant tissue categorical -99999 Missing value
date Year of growth: 2011-2015 Date YYYY-MM-DD -99999 Missing value
arm Experimental plots were located along 3 arms; each arm had one replicate each of 8 N treatments categorical -99999 Missing value
ntrt Field experimental N treatments were made with 8 applications per plot per year between mid-May and mid-August of each year categorical -99999 Missing value
year Year collected Date YYYY -99999 Missing value
percent_loss Amount of mass lost expressed as a percent of original mass numeric dimensionless -99999 Missing value
taxa Taxa observed at site character -99999 Missing value
attributes_nitrogen.txt
attributeName attributeDefinition class unit dateTimeFormatString missingValueCode missingValueCodeExplanation
year Year of growth: 2011-2015 Date YYYY -99999 Missing value
ntrt Field experimental N treatments were made with 8 applications per plot per year between mid May and mid August of each year categorical -99999 Missing value
arm Experimental plots were located along 3 arms; each arm had one replicate each of 8 N treatments categorical -99999 Missing value
net_primary_production The product of moss linear growth of stems (cm yr-1) and stem mass density (SMD) numeric gramsPerMeterSquaredPerYear -99999 Missing value
stem_mass_density Mass of 1-cm lengths of Sphagnum stems beneath the capitula per m2 numeric gramsPerSquaredMeterPerCentimeter -99999 Missing value
plant_density Number of plants/area numeric numberPerMeterSquared -99999 Missing value
stem_n_concentration N concentration in the 0-2 cm stem sections numeric milligramsPerGram -99999 Missing value
n_assimilated Amount of N used and stored per area of moss cover per year numeric gramsPerMeterSquaredPerYear -99999 Missing value
site_name Name of site character -99999 Missing value
site_lat Latitude in decimal degrees numeric degree -99999 Missing value
site_lon Longitude in decimal degrees numeric degree -99999 Missing value

custom_units.txt

(Required if non-standard units are used in a data tables attribute.txt file) Custom unit definition and relation to SI units facilitates human and machine understanding.

custom_units.txt is a tab delimited table with columns:

  • id Unit name (e.g.Â feetPerSecond)
  • unitType Unit type (e.g.Â velocity)
  • parentSI SI equivalent (e.g.Â metersPerSecond)
  • multiplierToSI Multiplier to SI equivalent (e.g.Â 0.3048)
  • description Abbreviation (e.g.Â ft/s)

Example:

custom_units.txt
id unitType parentSI multiplierToSI description
gramsPerSquaredMeterPerCentimeter areal mass density per length kilogramsPerSquaredMeterPerMeter 0.1 grams per meter squared per centimeter
milligramsPerGram mass kilogramsPerSquaredMeterPerMeter 1000 milligrams per gram

catvars_*.txt

(Required if an attributes table contains categorical class variables) Categorical variables require definitions to enable full understanding of data table contents.

catvars.txt is a tab delimited table with columns:

  • attributeName Column name
  • attributeDefinition Column definition
  • class Column class. Valid options are

Example:

catvars_decomp.txt
attributeName code definition
type Sphagnum Sphagnum
type Vascular Vascular
arm 1 Arm 1
arm 2 Arm 2
arm 3 Arm 3
ntrt C Control, no water, no N added
ntrt 0 0 kg N/ha/yr added
ntrt 5 5 kg N/ha/yr added
ntrt 10 10 kg N/ha/yr added as NH4NO3
ntrt 15 15 kg N/ha/yr added
ntrt 20 20 kg N/ha/yr added as NH4NO3
ntrt 25 25 kg N/ha/yr added
catvars_nitrogen.txt
attributeName code definition
ntrt C Control, no water, no N added
ntrt 0 0 kg N/ha/yr added as NH4NO3
ntrt 5 5 kg N/ha/yr added as NH4NO3
ntrt 10 10 kg N/ha/yr added as NH4NO3
ntrt 15 15 kg N/ha/yr added as NH4NO3
ntrt 20 20 kg N/ha/yr added as NH4NO3
ntrt 25 25 kg N/ha/yr added as NH4NO3
arm 1 Arm 1
arm 2 Arm 2
arm 3 Arm3

geographic_coverage.txt

(Optional) Documented sampling points and areas facilitate data package discovery based on geographic search criteria.

geographic_coverage.txt is a tab delimited table with columns:

  • geographicDescription Description of geographic point or area.
  • northBoundingCoordinate North coordinate
  • southBoundingCoordinate South coordinate
  • eastBoundingCoordinate East coordinate
  • westBoundingCoordinate West coordinate

Coordinates must be in decimal degrees and include a minus sign (-) for latitudes south of the equator and longitudes west of the prime meridian. For points, repeat latitude and longitude coordinates in respective north/south and east/west fields.

Example:

geographic_coverage.txt
geographicDescription northBoundingCoordinate southBoundingCoordinate eastBoundingCoordinate westBoundingCoordinate
site_1 45.23 45.23 -89.43 -89.43
site_2 45.24 45.24 -89.44 -89.44
site_3 45.25 45.25 -89.45 -89.45
site_4 45.26 45.26 -89.46 -89.46
site_5 45.27 45.27 -89.47 -89.47
site_6 45.28 45.28 -89.48 -89.48
site_7 45.29 45.29 -89.49 -89.49
site_8 45.3 45.3 -89.5 -89.5
site_9 45.31 45.31 -89.51 -89.51
site_10 45.32 45.32 -89.52 -89.52

taxonomic_coverage.txt

(Optional) Fully documented taxonomic ranks and authority IDs for each taxa enable data package discovery based on taxonomic search criteria.

taxonomic_coverage.txt is a tab delimited table with columns:

  • taxa_raw Taxa name as it occurs in the data. Can be single word or species binomial.
  • name_type (optional) Type of taxonomic name. Can be scientific or common.
  • name_resolved (optional) Taxaâ€™s name found in an authority system.
  • authority_system (optional) Authority system in which the taxaâ€™s scientific name was found (e.g.Â ITIS).
  • authority_id (optional) Taxaâ€™s identifier in the authority system (e.g.Â 168469).

name = taxa_raw, name_type = rep(â€˜scientificâ€™, length(taxa_raw)), name_resolved = rep(NA_character_, length(taxa_raw)), authority_system = rep(NA_character_, length(taxa_raw)), authority_id = rep(NA_character_, length(taxa_raw)),

Example:

taxonomic_coverage.txt
name name_type name_resolved authority_system authority_id
Mosses scientific NA NA NA
Unsorted biomass scientific NA NA NA
Achillea millefolium scientific Achillea millefolium ITIS 35423
Crepis tectorum scientific Crepis tectorum ITIS 37212
Cyperus sp. scientific Cyperus ITIS 39882
Euphorbia glyptosperma scientific Euphorbia glyptosperma ITIS 28074
Lespedeza capitata scientific Lespedeza capitata ITIS 25897
Lepidium densiflorum scientific Lepidium densiflorum ITIS 22960
Poa pratensis scientific Poa pratensis ITIS 41088
Rumex acetosella scientific Rumex acetosella ITIS 20934
Schizachyrium scoparium scientific Schizachyrium scoparium ITIS 42076
Bouteloua gracilis scientific Bouteloua gracilis ITIS 41493
Koeleria cristata scientific Koeleria cristata ITIS 515476
Liatris aspera scientific Liatris aspera ITIS 37909
scientific NA NA NA
